page.title: 01HARROGATE AS A CENTRE
page.content: Harrogate gets its name from{Herrigate or{Soldiers}Road.Possibly a military road passed over this area during the Anglian period. During 19th.Cent. a turnpike road ran through the town. In the Middle_Ages the area was covered by a vast forest known as Knaresborough Chase.Unfortantly this was destroyed during the 18th. Cent. when Harrogate was in the parish of Knaresborough. Harrogate is the areas largest town. It achieved fame as a spa and is now a conference centre. It's original claim to fame as a spa was in the 18th.Cent., but the first spring was discovered by William Slingsby in 1571.The town soon grew, and became one of the leading spas in the country. A spring can still be seen in the Royal Pump Room - now a museum. The hotels and restaurants. now support tourism and conferences.
